sentences.sContent: So they had bricks for stone and asphalt for mortar.
sentences.sContent_eng: So they had bricks for stone and asphalt for mortar.
sentences.sCn: 于是他们用砖代替石头，沥青代替灰泥。

sentences.sContent: Even the flimsiest of science fiction or the nastiest of horror stories or the most intricate of spy novels uses this as the mortar to bond together its narrative.
sentences.sContent_eng: Even the flimsiest of science fiction or the nastiest of horror stories or the most intricate of spy novels uses this as the mortar to bond together its narrative.
sentences.sCn: 即便是最天花乱坠的科幻小说、最荒唐无稽的恐怖小说和最错综复杂的间谍小说也都用这些元素作为粘合叙述的灰泥。

phrases.pCn: 诗灰浆；树脂胶浆；树脂砂浆

trans.tranOther: a mixture of  cement  or  lime  , and sand and water, used in building for holding bricks or stones together
